sen.j: 岩佐 一亭（いわさ いってい、安永（1779年）8年8月24日） - 安政5年(1858年)11月28日）は、江戸時代後期の日本の書家。
sen.e: Ittei IWASA (Aug 24 1779 - Nov 28, 1858) was a calligrapher of the latter part of the Edo period.
Ittei IWASA (Aug 24 1779 - Nov 28, 1858) was a Japanese calligrapher of the latter part of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れに対応しました。
sen.e: Ittei IWASA (October 3, 1779 - January 1, 1859) was a Japanese calligrapher of the latter part of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ歴に変更して月をフルスペルにしました。

sen.j: 名は善倫、字は君明、通称を市右衛門。
sen.e: His name was `善倫`, pen name '君明' and he was known by the common name `Ichiemon`.
His name was Yoshinori, azana popular name) was Kimiaki, and he was known by the common name Ichiemon.
sen.cmt: 善倫、君明：読みは憶測です。字は用語集より
sen.e: His name was Yoshinori, azana popular name) was Kimiaki, and he was known by the common name Ichiemon.

sen.j: 飛騨国高山町三之町に生れる。
sen.e: He was born in 三之町, Takayama, Hida Province
He was born in Sannomachi, Takayama-cho, Hida Province.
sen.cmt: 高山町三之町 http://www.city.takayama.lg.jp/bunkazai/documents/5-5-4_000.pdf#search='高山町三之町'
sen.e: He was born in Sannomachi, Takayama-cho, Hida Province.

sen.j: 代々呉服商を営む荒木屋の長子としていったんは家督を相続したが、後に弟 兵助に譲り、もっぱら書道の研究に没頭した。
sen.e: Being the eldest child, for a brief period of time he inherited the role of being family head and running a kimono fabric store (Araki-ya store) which had been run by the family for generations however, he later handed over that responsibility to his younger brother 兵助 and immersed himself entirely in the study of calligraphy.

Being the eldest child, for a brief period of time he inherited the role of being family head and running a kimono fabric store (Araki-ya store) which had been run by the family for generations; however, he later handed over that responsibility to his younger brother Hyosuke and immersed himself entirely in the study of calligraphy.
sen.cmt: 文法（punctuation）を修正しました 兵助：読みは憶測です

sen.j: 書ははじめ蜂賀仁助寿仁に手ほどきを受け、文化 (元号)9年（1812年）33歳で尾張蜂須賀村蓮華寺住職 大道定慶に入門。
sen.e: Initially he received more encouragement than skills from 蜂賀仁助寿仁 but, in 1812 at the age of 33 he joined the (Buddhist) priesthood as a pupil of chief priest Jokei of Renge-ji Temple located at Suga village in Owari Province.

Initially he learned calligraphy from 蜂賀仁助寿仁 but, in 1812 at the age of 33 he joined the (Buddhist) priesthood as a pupil of chief priest Daido-Jokei of Renge-ji Temple located at Suga village in Owari Province.
sen.cmt: 解釈の誤りのようです
sen.e: Initially he learned calligraphy from 蜂賀仁助寿仁 but, in 1812 at the age of 33 he joined the (Buddhist) priesthood as a pupil of chief priest Daido-Jokei of Renge-ji Temple located at Suga village in Owari Province.

sen.j: 書の流派である弘法大師流入木道（じゅぼくどう）の51世を授かる。
sen.e: Ittei became the 51st to inherit the traditions of the Kobodaishi school of calligraphy.
Ittei became the 51st to inherit the traditions of the Kobodaishi school of calligraphy.

sen.j: 天保3年（1832年）53歳、京都の狩野秀信のところに滞在し、書した絹本が仁孝天皇の天覧に供せられた。
sen.e: In 1832 at the age of 53 he stayed at Hidenobu KANO`s residence in Kyoto, and Ittei`s works on silk were viewed by Emperor Ninko.
In 1832 at the age of 53 he stayed at Hidenobu KANO`s residence in Kyoto, and Ittei`s works on silk were viewed by Emperor Ninko.

sen.j: 一亭が68~69歳の頃、山岡鉄舟が入門。
sen.e: At age 68 or 69, Tesshu YAMAOKA became a follower.

sen.j: 鉄舟に書の真髄を伝え、弘法大師流入木道52世を授ける。
sen.e: Ittei passed on the essence of calligraphy to Tessshu who became the 52nd inheritor of the Kobo Daishi legacy.
Ittei passed on the essence of calligraphy to Tessshu who became the 52nd inheritor of the Kobo Daishi legacy.

sen.j: 安政5年2月（1858年）、飛騨国分寺にて80歳の賀宴が催されたが、その年の11月に歿した。
sen.e: In February 1858 Ittei celebrated his 80th birthday at a temple in Hida Province however, passed away in November that year.
In February 1858 Ittei celebrated his 80th birthday at Hida Provincial Monastery; however, passed away in November that year.
